alert.note: Alert for Calumet; Manitowoc (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 3:14PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Calumet and Manitowoc Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 314 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fond Du Lac to near Campbellsport. Movement was northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... St Anna around 330 PM CDT. Camp Rokilio Scout Camp around 335 PM CDT. St. Nazianz around 340 PM CDT. Cleveland and Valders around 345 PM CDT. Manitowoc around 350 PM CDT. Two Creeks around 400 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Louis Corners, St Nazianz, Mishicot, Kellners Corners, Larrabee, Two Rivers, Kiel, Madsen, Millhome and Newtonberg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
